name: Energy and Environment: Economics, Politics, and Sustainability
description: This is an interdisciplinary course that examines key ideas in economics, politics and security that are essential to understanding energy and environmental issues. The course will cover energy markets, energy security, and the increasing role that sustainability plays in setting policies.
prerequisites: Students must have completed a minimum of 10.0 FCE's to register for the course.
exclusions: BIG101Y1; ENV382H1 if taken in 2015-16 or 2016-17
